title: Help Riot troubleshoot the mac bug
body:
Hi Summoners who use a Mac,

First off, you all are awesome and I want to emphasize that the existing Mac issue is a serious one to us. We verify every build on a Mac and test on Macs as well. Unfortunately, we dropped the ball this time and will strive to do better next time for you guys!

In the meantime, I would like more information to help pinpoint what the potential issues are since it was clearly introduced in the most recent patch (4.17). In particular, I'd like to know the following:

For items 1-3, hit the Apple icon in the top left, then "About this mac", then "More info"
1. What is your OSX version?
2. What type of Mac are you running (Macbook, Macbook Pro, etc) + year number
3. What graphics chipset are you running
4. What is the rough frequency of the crash per game for each game mode/type?
  - e.g. Custom 5v5 arams, matchmade 3v3 treeline, normal 5v5
  - Don't try this in ranked and consider making a smurf to test matchmade games (but only if you don't already know the crash frequency for matchmade games)
5. Do the crashes happen on PBE currently? (answer in a similar fashion to #4)

Any information you can provide would be very useful. In addition, if you leave a summoner name, I may contact you on my LoL account (Riot3ous) to get more information.

Thanks,
Riot3ous

edit:

Thanks all for the updates so far. We're pulling more resources internally to address the problem.

edit 2:

Again, thanks for your patience all. Still working ...

edit 3:

We identified yesterday TWO sources of a large number of crashes that unfortunately managed to slip in on a single patch. Turns out, they caused Windows crashes as well. A hotfix has been deployed. Thanks all for your patience.

replies.body: Quick update, messaging is on now I believe

I would like to point out a couple things. The current message on the client states that, "We are seeing problems with game crashes on MAC clients and are working to correct this"

I have had a discussion with Riot Triggs about this before but I see it has not made its way around to the rest of you guys. Now as when I told Triggs this, I don't want to sound like a jerk but I want to let you all know that its 'Mac' and not 'MAC' its not an acronym for anything, its just short for Macintosh. I don't mind if users get it wrong, but you guys are the company here and it would look better to the Mac user base if the developers of the game got it right in their communications with the players.

Secondly I would like to point out that there exists a Mac subform and it has seemingly been forgotten about by employees. You guys who are looking for information and logs should look here:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=31
I will link you all of the treads about the 4.17 crashing/bug splats, some of which contain logs (listed in order of most info provided):
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4879885 (lots of info and logs provided by this user)
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4900192 (3 pages, lots of users providing system specs)
http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1923814 (EUW user, logs provided)
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4898777 
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4901979
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4903874
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4886554

Here I will add my experiences with the problem as quoted from one of these threads, "I can also confirm that 4.17 is much worse in terms of bug splats on my Macbook. Prior to this patch I bug-splatted much more rarely. Yesterday I was playing in a pre made team of 5 with three of us playing on windows, and two of us playing on Macs. There was one instance where myself and the other Mac player both had a bug splat crash at the exact same time in the game. This also cost us the game despite us being able to reconnect." This occurred on my Mid 2010 White Unibody Macbook, which runs OS X 10.9.3. I can provide r3d logs if they are requested.

Lastly I would like to point out one more thing. While I am sad that the NA Mac sub forum is for some reason under used by Riot employees, with only Riot Brentmiester or Riot Dannamoth posting maybe every 2 months or so, there is something even worse occurring to our fellow summoners overseas. The EUNE and EUW equivalent of these subforms are ignored to an even greater extent than the NA sub forum. Perhaps you guys could post over there asking for info? It would make them feel a lot better. They have the same issues and threads as us, but never receive any information! I would post there myself if I had an account on those servers.
http://forums.eune.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=196
http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=187

**Other Mac bugs that are known that I'd like to draw some attention too:**
Mac Client freezing upon first death. This bug is coming up on its 1 year anniversary on my system. Its already past that for others:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4008524

Its currently impossible to patch a Mac client if its located on an external drive and not the boot drive. I no longer use PBE on my external drive because of this:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=46800665#46800665

Using LoL on Mac 10.6.8 results in message, "LoL quit unexpectedly" when it should say something along the lines of "You cannot use League of Legends with this version of OS X." Small problem, but it causes undue confusion to users who did not receive news about the minimum Mac specs being changed:
http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bugs/NkNITwUv-mac-client-new-pbe-launcher-will-not-patch-on-my-mac

> **Other Mac bugs that are known that I'd like to draw some attention too:**
> Mac Client freezing upon first death. This bug is coming up on its 1 year anniversary on my system. Its already past that for others:
> http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4008524

THE THINGS I WOULD DO IF THIS ONE IN PARTICULAR WAS FIXED
Yep this one got better a couple patches ago but came back. It really sucks for me because my main champion is zyra..hard to hit her passive if  I freeze when i die

Yea its the worst on Kog'Maw, Karthus, and Zyra. I feel your pain. For me it *usually* only happens on that first death so I can deal with it after that. But even then it can definitely cost you a kill, which is frustrating.

Yeah I freeze on almost every death (possibly every death? I almost don't notice anymore.) and it's been happening as long as I've played League (going on three years).

I'll be posting my specs too... just wanted to throw this out there.

I've only just started playing about 3 months ago, but I've noticed this on my mac as well. Each death, the screen will freeze right before the enemy champion's killing blow, then will return around 5-10 seconds later displaying the death screen.

I've also noticed that this occurs more often and with much longer delays when near either allied or enemy turrets.

I don't speak for everyone, but reading that MAC/Mac critique makes me cringe. As a mac player, i really don't care how the company capitalizes letters. I don't think people get offended when windows users get 'WIN' instead of Win.

Maybe you genuinely do want Rito(or should i say Riot?) to look professional with their terminology. In that case keep on correcting them :) Really though, this is a company of gamers, for gamers. For as much shit as they take for bad patches, unbalanced champions, server problems, and cats knocking over routers, I think you should give them a break c:

Just a guess, but maybe that guy was freaking out because MAC = Media Access Control. So he wanted to be knit-picky about it being spelled Mac. Either way, I think we just all want this to get fixed. I rarely ever had issues before the latest patch update. now it's bugsplat galore.

First, yes I use "Mac" in my writing so agreed that it should be changed.

Second, I posted in NA specifically because I wanted to know if the problem exists on PBE or if an incremental patch changed it. I'm looking at the other sources of info as well, but thanks a lot for consolidating it all. I will also try to keep EU in the loop although traditionally, Rioters participate primarily in the region they work in. Part of what makes this a challenge is that pretty much all the game engineers are based in the US with the exception of a few contractors maybe. Perhaps we can think of a more centralized communication channel for engineering communication.

Last, thanks a lot for attaching the other bugs to your post. I can't make promises about when they get fixed but at least now they will be included when bugs are stack ranked based on severity.

+1 everything this guy says!

Mac client seems to get the least love from Riot and there are lots of basic UI and UX bugs that clearly are being missed and not fixed because of the lack of love from Riot. I would really encourage Riot to have someone full time hired who has a background in developing for Mac and who can do some QA on Mac for LoL.
can we at least get loss prevented?

Not sure if this is useful, but after every one of these 4.17 Mac crashes, there are patches of "false vision" after reconnecting at top, bot lane and the baron pit where the lighting is bright like its warded but you can't see anything you shouldnt.

Maybe the bug is related to vision?

This has definitely happened to me, where wards that were previously placed look to still have vision over an area after disappearing but they really don't. I've also had a couple times where turrets that were destroyed, do not look like they were destroyed when I reloaded after a crash. They even still have their health bar when I click on them, they just have no function and minions walk past it like nothing.

I replied to a comment below as well... but in the hopes that this gets seen, I'm re-commenting.

My system specs are as follows:

> Processor 2.3 GHz Intel Core i7
> Memory 16 GB 1600 MHz DDR3
> Graphics NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M 2048 MB
> Software OS X 10.9.4 (13E28)


I checked the console, and without fail, before the game crashes, there are a dozen or so errors that follow this format:

> 9/28/14 9:43:35.904 PM LeagueofLegends[66531]: LeagueofLegends(66531,0xa03061a8) malloc: *** error for object 0x41d39e10: pointer being freed was not allocated
> *** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug

These are immediately followed by:

> 9/27/14 6:11:15.614 PM LeagueofLegends[58532]: BugSplatFramework: exceptionHandler: shouldLogException name: NSUncaughtSystemExceptionException
> reason: Uncaught system exception: signal 10
> mask: 4
> 9/27/14 6:11:15.614 PM LeagueofLegends[58532]: NSExceptionHandler has recorded the following exception:
> NSUncaughtSystemExceptionException -- Uncaught system exception: signal 10
> Stack trace:  0x9482589d  0x906d7deb  0xffffffff  0x1e92e4  0x1ea910  0x1ed500  0x1f1aec  0x1f2c0d  0x1f2ec1  0x226fd8  0x654a18  0x1f33e2  0x7c05  0x5
> 9/27/14 6:11:15.615 PM LeagueofLegends[58532]: BugSplatFramework: exceptionHandler: shouldHandleException name: NSUncaughtSystemExceptionException
> reason: Uncaught system exception: signal 10
> mask: 8
> 9/27/14 6:11:15.615 PM LeagueofLegends[58532]: BugSplatFramework: getCrashReport: /Users/fast/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports/LeagueofLegends
> 9/27/14 6:11:15.618 PM LeagueofLegends[58532]: BugSplatFramework: sendCrashReport: BugsplatReporter is running
> 9/27/14 6:11:15.639 PM gkbisd[136]: Unable to collect cdhash for /Applications/League of Legends.app/Contents/LoL/RADS/solutions/lol_game_client_sln/releases/0.0.0.135/deploy/LeagueOfLegends.app/Contents/Frameworks/BugSplat.framework/Versions/A/BugsplatReporter.app (error code 100024)
> 

I feel like I've seen these errors prior to this update... but not with this frequency.  

Clearly, there's some kind of reference to a pointer that was already freed...  Then, in the actual log file itself (attached), the exception type is EXC_BAD_ACCESS, and then we get a KERN_PROTECTION_FAILURE.

SO... Somewhere in your code, you're referencing a pointer that doesn't exist anymore...and then when you attempt to access it, the OS says "NO", and immediately kills the application.

Thanks for the info! To be precise we are trying to dealloc memory referenced by a pointer twice for some reason. The stuff that you posted below that is primarily the Bugsplat software doing its job.

You should have written league in Java. Like Runescape.

No pointers. :P
Heh, no pointers but random intermittent garbage collection cycles that make latency nondeterministic. Also, our min spec would have to go up quite a bit.
Can we get an update on this? I'm sure I'm not the only one wondering how things are developing.
Will the upcoming matienence solve anything?

I am having random crashes with patch 4.17 too, except using the Windows client under Linux with WINE.

-When playing a game (i.e. non-spectated), the League of Legends.exe portion of the client is incredibly crash-prone regardless of video/quality settings, particularly when many characters are onscreen. (These crashes are caught by BugSplat and are not handled by Wine's debugger.)

-BugSplat crash reports sent in the event of the above have a 50% chance of actually having their data sent to Riot. (The third step in sending the report will return "Failed.")
PS: DOTA2 on steam has a Linux client. Please make one for LoL too since it is a way better game!

1. OSX Mavericks 10.9.4
2. Mac Mini mid 2011 - I upgraded the RAM. The default was 2 GB (two 1 GB chips). I upgraded to 8 GB (two 4 GB chips), kingston brand, mac approved.
3. Intel HD Graphics 3000 512 MB
4. Summoner's rift ranked solo/duo - maybe once every 2 or 3 games. I haven't been playing other modes. If this bug wrecks ranked games, so be it. Better fix it fast.
5. no PBE access

Misc info (copied from "about this mac")

Mac mini
Mid 2011
Processor  2.3 GHz Intel Core i5
Memory  8 GB 1333 MHz DDR3
Graphics  Intel HD Graphics 3000 512 MB
Serial Number  *****
Software  OS X 10.9.4 (13E28)

EDIT: didn't mean to sound like a dick or anything, but, if this is so severe that I shouldn't be playing ranked, then maybe ranked should be disabled until this is fixed? Not everyone reads the forums. You have thousands of mac users jumping into ranked right now, with no idea why they are crashing (potentially blaming it on their internet connection, since internet lag also bugsplats a mac quite easily). I'm gonna be playing ranked until you disable it.

> You have thousands of mac users jumping into ranked right now, with no idea why they are crashing (potentially blaming it on their internet connection, since internet lag also bugsplats a mac quite easily). I'm gonna be playing ranked until you disable it.

I was one of those people... I finally got fed up and came to the forums to see if anyone else was having a problem... I'm so close to my gold promos, but my client keeps crashing at the worst possible times... :(
edited my post: maybe you should disable ranked if this is so serious?

ok i just logged back into my account and leavebuster has banned my account. I have never left a game or been idle except for the crashes caused by this bug. What is riot going to do ???
My accounts are banned due to a BUG they created.

Someone from riot please respond.

Is this issue considered closed? I'm still crashing 2-3 times per match (with some exceptions).

Any official comment?

1 - Mac OS X 10.9.5
2 - Macbook Pro 13-inch, Mid 2012
3 - Intel HD Graphics 4000 1024 MB
4 - **Wont load** any game regardless of mode, it gets stuck on a black screen and no error message ever come, I can't command + tab also, have to force quit by pressing command + option + esc. The Launcher works fine though, everything is normal until the game is started and gets stuck.
5 - No PBE account

It seems that this isn't the problem of the majority here, people are complaining about crashes but they aren't saying that they can't play, I can't play at all! So I would like to know if you guys are aware of that and will fix it.

I have already made the repair couple times, switched regions, tried to delete and download everything again but this wouldn't work, the download would fail at some point, so I had to restore the old file.

If this is a known issue please give me a link so I can fix it, I keep searching but best I found is this forum.

Thanks!

1. OSX Yosemite Beta 10.10
2. MacBook Pro (13-inch, Late 2011)
3. Intel HD Graphics 3000 384 MB
4. Ranked, 5v5, and ARAM, also happened during Asencion.
-It's pretty bad, every time I die, I freeze for about 1 second, maybe .5 seconds before I die, and I usually can't even tell what killed me.
-----------THIS ONE is the one that makes me really, really frustrated: about once a game every other game I'l just freeze, my champion and all the graphics stand in place, but I don't get any "attempting to reconnect" popup or anything ALSO:: when this happens, I can't switch out of the League window like I can normally, I've tried everything, and at one point I was able to open iTunes in the background, but I can't leave the League window at all, this is so bad, it's happened multiple times during ranked games and every time I have to restart my computer. If I wait any longer than a minute or so (I've waited the 5-10 minutes to see if it reconnects) when I restart my computer, I reconnect but then it kicks me out because of lack of activity and I have to reconnect again.
5. I don't have access to PBE.

The only reason I posted was because I haven't seen anyone else describe their crashes in the second way I described mine.

Thank you for finally paying attention to the Mac client though.

> -----------THIS ONE is the one that makes me really, really frustrated: about once a game every other game I'l just freeze, my champion and all the graphics stand in place, but I don't get any "attempting to reconnect" popup or anything ALSO:: when this happens, I can't switch out of the League window like I can normally,

Isn't this the crashing everyone is going on about?  What other new bug is common if not this?

Anyway, you can force quite LoL.  Command-Option-Esc.  Just like any other non-responsive program.  Should save you on restarting your computer.

omg, I know I must sound stupid but you have no idea how relieved I am to find out it wasn't my computer messing up - It got to the pointwhere I transferred all of my pictures to an external hard drive because I thought using up all but a few gb's was killing it but it didn't fix the crashing --- thank you!

Well I have noticed in the past the OS X starts getting wonky if you have under a Gb left on your drive, so freeing up space before you hit that might be a good idea.  Or installing a bigger HD.  Having just done so on my macbook, it's really not hard at all to do yourself.  You can get an external enclosure as well and stick your old hard drive in that as backup.

And keep in mind how to force quit things (Command + Option + Esc).  It's useful to avoid hard-resetting your whole computer when something hangs.
i have had similar crashes and freeze issues on every death but the full on screen freezes that prevent me from closing league are rare.
This has been happening to me as well its really frustrating hopefully then can fix soon.

>about once a game every other game I'l just freeze, my champion and all the graphics stand in place, but I don't get any "attempting to reconnect" popup or anything ALSO:: when this happens, I can't switch out of the League window like I can normally, I've tried everything
>
>and every time I have to restart my computer. If I wait any longer than a minute or so
> 
> The only reason I posted was because I haven't seen anyone else describe their crashes in the second way I described mine.


I can confirm this has happened to me as well...you are not alone!

Got the patch and downloaded it. 3 TIMES IN 1 GAME i was kicked off. This time it wasn't bugs plat the client freezed and i had to shut off my mac altogether. This is losing me lp. no loss forgiven nothing. This is outrageous this has been going on for 4 days now. Mac users are not feeling the love. And I'm sure i speak for many. We are very frustrating. Everyday i check for an update. "still working". Seems as if mac users are not priority i dont know

My friend MissRiptide is running a Mac and crashing every game.  Here are her stats:

1. OSX 10.9.4
2. Air 2012
3. Intel HD graphic 4000
4. Dropping out of every game, only plays 5v5
-Here's a link to her last match she dropped out of: http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1562574256/221556567
-She usually makes it about halfway into a game before crashing out
5. Doesn't use PBE

MissRiptide just got an email warning her that she achieved level 1 leaverbuster stauts because of this crash.  Will this be remedied?

Let me know if I can help any more
-Riptide063
On summuners rift i disconnect 2 times every game

Is this issue is considered fix ? Because, for me it's not. I didn't see the warning about game crashed in mac client, but it's still doing it. It's really sad that I can't play at all for now one weeks. 

1. What is your OSX version? Version 10.8.5
2. What type of Mac are you running (Macbook, Macbook Pro, etc) Macbook Pro 2013
3. What graphics chipset are you running : Intel HD Graphics 4000 512 Mo
4. What is the rough frequency of the crash per game for each game mode/type?
- e.g. Custom 5v5 arams, matchmade 3v3 treeline, normal 5v5 :
 I've only played Normal 5v5… And I'm crashing at the beginning of the game, and I continue crashing 3 times or more.

{{champion:150}} I'm sad, i want to play Gnar again :(

I am having a problem with my Macbook League of Legends launcher. I click on the League of Legends icon, and it's not even opening. My computer freezes indefinitely. I was hoping you guys could fix this problem quickly because I think a few people are having this problem. Please upvote if u are having the same problem. Thx

Hey Rito,

Not at all a complaint so much as an observation, it might help soothe the aggravated masses (myself included, to some degree) for us to hear regular updates on the issue(s) and the progress you are (or aren't) making towards publishing a conclusive fix.

- Aggravated but docile Summoner who wishes Rito was communicative :)

I have not even been able to log into my account for about a week now. Riot said they fixed the problem with crashing but I haven't even been able to log in to begin with. It keeps telling me "connection error" and I have no idea why. I tried redownloading the game and restarting my computer, but nothing works. Can someone PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE help me! I just wanna play League!!!!!!!! PLEASE!!

same god damn crashes. these damn things are making me slowly drop rank. I literally cant even play now, this is hurting literally everyone playing. Because as soon as a mac player crashes then the game goes to shit. this needs to be fixed asap and then some sort of compensation. I have lost atleast 10 ranked matches because the "patch" was supposed to "fix" the bugsplat issue. well I got more bugsplats not than I ever have with anything. So gg riot good job making a ton of players pissed.

My first comment, wow. I've been having a huge problem with crashing and freezing in 5v5s and bot games as well. 
1. My processor is 1.8 GHz Intel Core i5
2. I have a Macbook Air from 2012
3. Intel HD Graphics 4000 1024 MB
4. I crash every game no matter the mode. I crash trying to connect into the game from the very beginning, sometimes I can't even connect to a game at all until my 4th or 5th try. I crash after 10 minutes, it's all very random. It crashes when I've just got into lane, or when I'm attacking a minion, it doesn't matter if I just died, it crashes whenever it wants. Normal 5v5s I can't even play anymore because of the amount of crashes I have each game.

Riot recently sent me an email saying I was a level 1 Leaver and that's all because of the crashes. I keep trying to connect and it just doesn't work. Hello! 

My info:
- OSX 10.9.5
- Macbook Air, Mid-2012
- Intel HD Graphics 4000 1024 MB
- Frequency is variable. Since the issue has sprung up, I usually start with a one-man custom Howling Abyss (vs bots) to check the stability. On this I will Bugsplat about every 4th attempt, usually at loading screen, after which I'm usually OK to rejoin. About every other game I will DC, to the point of having to shut down the client and restart. If I'm able to get through 3-4 bot matches in a row without incident, I'll try an ARAM, from which I DC every 3rd or 4th match. I have horrendous community Internet (God bless all-bills-included student apartment living), so I assume a lot of the DC issues are from the inconsistent connection I have, but some of the DCs feel different; more abrupt and sudden.

The largest crash I experienced was yesterday when I DC'ed 2 minutes into an ARAM. Upon trying to rejoin, the client Bugsplat. At this point, my computer's Wifi showed I was connected, but I couldn't even connect through a browser. The computer remained this way for about 10 minutes before the connection randomly came back up, and I was able to get back on to the client (the game had apparently finished though, as my match history stated I left the game).
- I haven't been approved for PBE yet, sadly. (Probably would help if I got the nerve to start playing ranked.)

tl;dr - Crashes/DCs are there, but wildly inconsistent.

I hope this helps, and thank you for reaching out to us!

Sincerely,
Porosaurus NA 
(the summoner formerly known as captcourage)

P.S. - I hope this gets tracked down soon...there is nothing I look forward to more than a few rounds of League after a long day in my PhD program!
